details.title: On deception jamming for countering bistatic ISAR based on sub-Nyquist sampling

authors.name: Guoyu Wang

details.abstract: Bistatic inverse synthetic aperture radar (ISAR) operates with spatially separated transmitting and receiving antennas. This study presents a method capable of generating deceptive images from a series of intercepted bistatic ISAR chirp pulses. It is demonstrated that deceptive false-target images will be induced by the under-sampled pulses which are retransmitted to a moving target and scattered by it under the principles of bistatic ISAR configuration. Additionally, the jamming idea is proved to be applicable based on the characteristics of the false-target images and the requirement of jamming power. A scattering model of Yak-42 plane with 330 point scatterers is adopted to verify the effectiveness of the jamming idea.

ieee.title: High-Resolution Range Profile Deception Method Based on Phase-Switched Screen
ieee.displayText: Letao Xu, Dejun Feng, Ran Zhang, Xuesong Wang, "High-Resolution Range Profile Deception Method Based on Phase-Switched Screen", Antennas and Wireless Propagation Letters IEEE, vol. 15, pp. 1665-1668, 2016, ISSN 1536-1225.

ieee.title: A dual-antenna active-echo-cancellation method for synthetic aperture radar
